SEARCH
Package solvers.backtrack

Class Backtrack

java.lang.Object
solvers.Solver
solvers.backtrack.Backtrack
public class Backtrack extends Solver
Implements a Backtracking solver for Sudoku puzzles.

This class extends the Solver class and utilizes a recursive backtracking algorithm to find a solution for a given Sudoku grid. It attempts to fill empty cells with valid symbols, backtracking when a dead end is reached.

  • Method Details

    • solve

      public void solve()
      Solves the Sudoku grid using the backtracking algorithm.

      This method initiates the backtracking process by calling the recursive backtrack(int, int) method starting from the top-left cell (row 0, column 0). It logs the start and end of the backtracking process using SLF4j logger.

      Specified by:
      solve in class Solver
      See Also:
      • backtrack(int, int)

    • getNumberOfSolutions

      public int getNumberOfSolutions()
      Specified by:
      getNumberOfSolutions in class Solver

    • backtrack

      private boolean backtrack(int row, int col)
      Recursively attempts to solve the Sudoku grid using backtracking.

      This is the core method of the backtracking algorithm. It tries to fill the cell at the given row and col with a valid symbol. If successful, it recursively calls itself for the next cell. If it reaches a dead end or finds a conflict, it backtracks by resetting the current cell and trying the next possible symbol.

      Parameters:
      row - The current row index to process.
      col - The current column index to process.
      Returns:
      true if a solution is found from this point, false otherwise. Returns true when the entire grid is filled successfully (base case).
